content.description: A vicious boulder problem crux leads to fun, reachy and pumpy finish. The rock is solid and a bright, beautiful orange.
content.location: When you take the fork at the throne, pass under Quantum Leap and look to your right.

content.description: Thin seam with the crux off the ground to easy climbing.
content.protection: SR. Tree Anchor(x3 with sufficient webbing, otherwise x1)
content.location: Climbers right of Albino Rhino. Thin seam to the left of a stump.

content.description: Off the ground crux to easier climbing.
content.protection: SR. Tree Anchor(see Young Buzz description)
content.location: Climbers Right of Albino Rhino. To the left of a stump near the wall.

content.description: Start left of crack on crimps, lunge to pocket. Place pro in horizontals...slight run to start route. Crux the crimp start and second crux is at lone bolt. Very fun face route with positve crimps and edges.
content.protection: Few small hand to hand size pieces. QD for glue in bolt.

content.description: If you are lucky enough to own the original Sams Throne guidebook, maybe you have seen or top-roped the line "Quantum Leap".  I never did, because I thought it looked contrived and more effort than it was worth to set up the TR.     In the fall of 07, under the encouragement of others, I lead this route and redirected the line to add more climbing, and bolted anchors for those still wanting to TR this dynamic and wild ride. It is the "Love Slave" of Sams- very similar to the route of that name at HCR, down river- maybe a little more sustained.
content.location: when you take the fork upon reaching the throne, QL is to the left 100 feet in a cave.

content.description: Dark face up to a ledge. Then a small thin flake just left of the dihedral. The crux is a technical sequence between the flake and dihedral.
content.protection: 1 bolt at the flake. 2 bolt anchor. Rack to #2 Camalot.
content.location: Start in the middle of the dark face streak just right of Albino Rhino.

content.description: Pre-clip the second bolt if possible. Make a funky mantle onto a undercut sloping ledge. A low crux leads to a large pocket left of the first bolt. A second crux with small feet and nub crimps lead to a ledge. Cruise jug face sequences to the top. Used to be a mixed route.
content.location: On the vague, rounded arete between Eminence Front and Sweet Charlie/Young Buzz.

content.description: An imposing face that is much easier than would first appear. The crux is found in the first two bolts, pulling through to the arete. A balancey technical series of moves leads to a good rest and a cam slot.  Above here, what looks to be a blank face reveals large in-cut holds and plenty of protection opportunities.
content.protection: 3 bolts + standard rack. Nuts and .75 cam important. Tree Anchor.
content.location: Around the corner to the right of "Eminent Front". Start in the chimney that is the route "Wild Thing", then step out on the face to the left locating the small hole and clipping the first bolt. Traverse out to the pod and go up the blunt arete.

content.description: Follow up easy flake system to short face to small roof with block. Crank through crux and climb crimps to anchors.
content.location: Alcove to the right of Mandolin Gypsy.

content.description: Good chimney with some holds in it.
content.protection: Gear to 4", trees at top for anchors.
content.location: The obvious chimney between Mandolin Gypsy and Hitchhiker.

content.description: Pumpy start and more moderate finish.  Follow the left crack up to the roof for better hands and pro.
content.protection: First piece is high!  Bolt anchors at the top.
content.location: Around the corner (to the left) from Mandolin Gypsy.

content.description: Start up the flake on the left side of the black streak to the ledge. Then follow the obvious holds between the dark and light rock to the anchors shared with 'Past the Jugs' to the right.
content.protection: 2 anchors (shared with 'Past the Jugs' on the right).
content.location: Start on the left side of the black streak just right of Albino Rhino.

content.description: Climb the dihedral handcrack over a few small bulge-like sections.  This is one of the most popular lead routes at Sam's.
content.protection: Gear to 3.5".  2 bolt anchor.  Rap or lower.
content.location: In the dihedral on the left end of the South Side, this is the dihedral handcrack, named after the horn halfway up.

content.description: Traverse right from bottom ledge, commit through techs sequence and fire up moderate terrain.
